intro: Maillea urvillei var. sardoa, commonly known as the Sardoa bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories or rocky slopes. Its leaves are lanceolate and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowering period occurs during the summer months. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
